intro: Schizoglossum viridulum, commonly known as the green threadleaf, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, elongated leaves that are usually green and slightly hairy, with a distinct, thread-like appearance. It produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Schizoglossum viridulum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
